It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Manager of the McClung Historical Collection, 500 West Church Avenue, Knoxville, TN, 37902-2505. (865) 215-8801.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1813 Feb. 3, Rhea County, Tennessee / George Starns
bibl.author: Starns, George
bibl.note: This document is a receipt for a fourteen year old boy who was sold to one Henry Welker by one George Starns of Rhea County Tennessee, February 3, 1813.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p:
Know all men by these presents that I george Starns of the county of Rhea and state of tennessee for and in consideration of the sum of three hundred dollars to me in hand paid by Henry Welker of the county and state above mentioned I have this day granted bargened and sold and by these presents doth grant bargen and sell unto Henry Welker a negroe boy named Billy of the age of fourteen years to have and to hold the sd negroe boy to himself and his heirs for ever and I the sd starns for myself my heirs &c will for ever warrant and defend the sd negroe boy unto the sd Henry Welker against the claim or claims of any other person or persons in witness whereof I have here unto set my hand and seal this 3 february 1813
Testseal

The Execution of the within Bill of sale was proven in Open Court by the oath of Jesse Davidson the subscribing witness thereto, And afterwards at the same Term George Starns the Bargonor therein namendappeared in Open Court and duly acknowledged the execution of the same as his act and deed for the purposes therein expressed— Let it be Registered Given under my hand and private seal having no seal of Office at Office this 17th day of March 1813
George sarnes bill of sale to Henry Welker
Registers Office of Rhea County The 27th of september 1813
Then was the within Bill of sale with the certificate thereon endorsed Registered here in Book C. page 130
